caption: The food is really different and delicious .. and that is a high bar for me since I love trying new things and have had a lot of years to hunt down new flavors. However, it is on the expensive side for Gainesville
Simply great food drinks and staff. Love the atmosphere
Such good food in Gainesville! Would go back any time.
Walked in and was treated like family. Hospitality at its finest. Bing Bam Boom, it was like they read my mind. Food was delicious and service was quick. Thank you chef and staff.
Has a cool vibe, cosy, food is fast and tasty. Amazing service... kudos to chef steve. What a nice little nook...  bbq fries are a must!

I was excited to try this place because it reminded me of another restaurant - Piggy Smalls (it’s in Hawaii). Unfortunately, this restaurant did not live up to my expectations. The food is decent. But the restaurant needs to be more organized.  It looks understaffed and has poor space utilization.
Great food, amazing atmosphere, and adorable fox art!

Loved my first trip to WayWard Fox. You can tell a lot of time and thought went into creating both the food and drink menu. We went with a group of 4 and split small plates. Loved it and will be back. The Korean BBQ fries were my favorite.
Wonderful food and nice atmosphere!

Wayward Fox is a wonderful addition to the Gainesville downtown food scene. Super classy shareable food with TONS of vegetarian and vegan options. Each small plate they have on the menu is good for a meal by itself, or great for ordering several and sharing amongst your group.  We had the Fresh Veggie Spring Rolls and Fried Chicken Nuggs and both were delicious with a hint of Thai spiciness but not so spicy as to cause discomfort and pain. The sweetness of the spring rolls was refreshing balanced with the tingle of the spicy peanut sauce. I came super hungry while my date was less so, I ate all the chicken (she's a vegetarian) and half the roll and I felt totally satisfied.  The bar program really feels well thought out with little to no fluff added. We had 4 different items from the drink menu and each one was great. The "Protect Ya Cuke" was the best cucumber gimlet I'd had in Gainesville, and the "Buzzwords" cocktail was a pleasantly unique journey for a scotch lover like myself. The "Springtime in the Bronx" reminded me of drinking fun drinks by the pool in August and the "Hai Chi" was a great twist on Thai Tea although I think if I ordered it again I would have them make it a double as the bourbon gets a little lost in the sweetness of the rest of the drink.  The atmosphere feels higher classes than Gainesville is used to with beautiful murals on the walls and dim (maybe too dim if you need to read the menus) lighting in the bar area which makes it feel like a classy New York city hotel bar. The music was a great mix of old school hip hop jams all night.  I can't wait to see how Wayward Fox develops over time as they really find their stride.
Cocktail menu was very creative and purposeful. Good vegetarian options on the dinner menu. Trendy vibe that's still authentic Gainesville.
Unique and tasty "small plates", fun atmosphere. No complaints!
An excellent concept with exceptional drinks and food.
Amazing food and inexpensive as well. Don’t wanna say too much come check it out yourself

I'm really impressed by this place. It's authentically "Gainesville" with sophisticated food. I hope the menu changes over time so that I can see the creativity of the chef with more items. I think the prices are very reasonable and our table of 4 ordered maybe 10 different things to try, loved every bite, and our bill wasn't shocking.  The service was a little disorganized but that's too be expected for a soft open restaurant; I expect it will only get better over time. I will definitely be coming back and I hope Wayward Fox is here to stay. It adds a little something to Gainesville.

We really enjoy Crane Ramen and were excited to try this place out, but it let us down in a few ways. First of all, the food was pretty good--the dishes are creative and tasty, but didn't blow our minds. Alcohol beverages were small for the cost and did not taste great. Now for my biggest gripe. So, this place is counter service, not full service.  What is particularly awkward is that the food/drinks are a bit pricey, and you pay upfront and are confronted with a tip line for service (in our case, our bill was $60, so a $12 tip at 20%). How can you tip for service (particularly $12) if you haven't received any yet and it's not full service? You really don't even realize the level of service provided until after you order, when you find out fountain beverages are self-serve and you pick up your own plates/silverware. I have no problem paying a 20% tip for even average service because I know oftentimes wait staff aren't paid a living wage, but this situation was really off-putting. It would help to switch to paying after your meal where you can tip an amount appropriate for the level of service received.  UPDATE 1/10/2020: How cool of the owner to respond and change their process! Thank you! Star added :).

This is hands-down the best food in Gainesville. My husband and I became spoiled foodies over 9 years in New York City, so we are pretty picky about food. Wayward Fox is a welcome addition to Gainesville's restaurant scene, with fun, fresh cuisine that makes you slap the table and swear in ecstacy. No, I'm not being dramatic; that's what my husband did after two bites of the brisket wontons. The boozy Thai iced tea was the drink I didn't know I had been searching for my whole life. The seafood omelette was pure, fluffy, umami heaven.  I can't say enough good things about the food, and the staff was its equal in friendliness and service. Stop what you're doing and go eat this food!

Very aesthetically pleasing, comfortable atmosphere, and amazing food. Couldn’t ask for more. The veggie dumplings and  Korean bbq Beef fries are Absolutely to die for. The Staff is very friendly and a pleasure to chat with when they have the time.

We were slightly worried that there weren’t very many people in the restaurant, boy were we surprised!  This place is the real deal. The family style menu is super fun and encourages the exact sort of exploration that our titular Fox apparently went through himself (ask the staff to hear the beautiful story behind the murals on the walls).  Highly recommended the steak fries and the dumplings. Although you really can’t go wrong, this place is high quality and excitingly creative. A rarity in Gainesville! Try it out!

The food was too delicious that I didn’t stop to take pictures! We had the veggie and beef pozole as well as the veggie dumplings and everything was absolutely delicious!! Service was great, atmosphere was lively and the fox themed murals were amazing! I thought I was going to miss Andaz, but this was a lively, excellent addition to downtown Gainesville!!

American Izakaya, think gastropub but with exceptional flair, you won't find a regular old cheese burger here. I had the tossed rice, Korean chipotle BBQ beef, with nahm prik (Grilled Mixed Peppers and herbs muddled in a mortar and pestle) we also got a house salad. Sauces are made in house, the spicy fish sauce blends wonderfully with rice, and the chipotle sauce has a wonderful sweet and spicy flavor with some smoke. The Fox House salad comes with a delicious miso vinaigrette, all in all the food was superb. Dining experience is trendy with eclectic music and lots of conversation. I got to sit down with the owner and bend his ear a bit, make sure to ask about the murals, they tell a great story. Dining experience is similar to tapas, ask the staff for guidance they'll take care of you.  Curry and noodles will change once a month with other possible seasonal rotations as well. All in all I give them a 5/5 for a startup restaurant, staff is exceptionally welcoming and super informative and friendly, I'm excited to see where they go from here and I hope you who are reading this enjoy them too!
Stopped in for appetizers and enjoyed the food. We will need to return for a full meal at some point.
